meanings.definition: To stamp or impress a design or mark into a surface.
meanings.sent1: She incuses her initials on all her belongings.
meanings.sent2: The artist incuses intricate patterns onto the metal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel incuses tiny paw prints in the snow.
meanings.sent4: His words incuses a lasting impact on her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's chisel incuses beautiful details into the marble.

meanings.definition: Marks or designs stamped or impressed into a surface.
meanings.sent1: The ancient coin displayed intricate incuses on its surface.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry had delicate incuses that caught the light.
meanings.sent3: The cake had edible incuses of flowers and leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas with memories as incuses.
meanings.sent5: The notebook cover had elegant incuses of vines and birds.
